page.title: 13WOODLESFORD LOCK
page.content: Woodlesford Lock is situated on the Aire and Calder canal. The average number of boats that pass through each day is between 3 and 4. They are mainly pleasure craft with one or two oil tankers. The largest boats that pass through are the Humber Progress, Pride and Prince. They are all 190ft in length. The lock was built in the 1860's. The lock-keeper's name is Mr.Cocksedge and he has worked at the lock for 16 years he lives next to the lock and keeps the grounds around it neat and tidy. This lock is operated by machine and is serviced once a week. The area around the lock is kept very neat and tidy by Mr. Cocksedge, he has planted many shrubs and daffodils.
